title: Space Development Agency to evaluate SpiderOak cybersecurity software
summary: WASHINGTON — The cybersecurity firm SpiderOak has signed an agreement with the U.S. Space Development Agency to research the use of the company’s software to protect ground systems that control […]

title: Blue Origin unveils plans for orbital transfer vehicle
summary: Blue Origin formally announced plans Oct. 16 to develop an orbital maneuvering vehicle, confirming a year’s worth of comments and speculation about the project.

title: China to launch Queqiao-2 moon relay satellite in early 2024
summary: China is preparing to place a new communications satellite in lunar orbit to facilitate ambitious upcoming moon landing missions.

title: Seraphim unveils the 10 startups in its twelfth space accelerator
summary: Startups specializing in healthcare, propulsion, and tackling climate change are among 10 space-based businesses taking part in Seraphim Space’s latest accelerator program, the British investment firm announced Oct. 17.

title: University of California and NASA Ames unveil plans for $2 billion Berkeley Space Center
summary: The University of California, Berkeley, and the NASA Ames Research Center unveiled plans Oct. 16 for a $2 billion Berkeley Space Center at NASA Research Park.
